DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the optimal dose of botulinum toxin type A injected in the detrusor muscle to improve urinary symptoms, urodynamic parameters and quality of life of continent women suffering from idiopathic overactive bladder.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Botulinum Toxin Type-A (Dysport®) in Continent Female Subjects Suffering From Idiopathic Overactive Bladder
DOC.criteria: The subject has a diagnosis of idiopathic overactive bladder, without incontinence. The subject has ≥ 3 urgency episodes over the course of the 3 days immediately preceding the Baseline visit. The subject has ≥ 24 episodes of micturition over the course of the 3 days immediately preceding the Baseline visit. Bladder outlet obstruction (on urodynamic assessment). PostMicturition Residual Volume > 150 ml (ultrasound assessment). Evidence of a urinary tract infection at Screening or Baseline in the study. Active or history of interstitial cystitis, malignancy of the bladder or urothelial tract, a carcinoma in situ (non malignant melanoma is allowed) bladder and/or kidney stones.
